00040 #ifndef _colourvalue_h
00041 #define _colourvalue_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 
00046 namespace Ogre
00047 {
00048     class ColourValue;
00049 }
00050 
00051 namespace phys
00052 {
00053     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00054     /// @class ColourValue
00055     /// @headerfile colourvalue.h
00056     /// @brief This is a simple class for holding 4 reals representing the colour any give object or lightsource can have.
00057     /// @details
00058     ///////////////////////////////////////
00059     class PHYS_LIB ColourValue
00060     {
00061         public:
00062             /// @brief Value from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the amount of red present in the colour.
00063             Real Red;
00064             /// @brief Value from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the amount of green present in the colour.
00065             Real Green;
00066             /// @brief Value from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the amount of blue present in the colour.
00067             Real Blue;
00068             /// @brief Value from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the transparency of the colours.
00069             Real Alpha;
00070 
00071             /// @brief Non-Alpha constructor.
00072             /// @details This constructor assumes the alpha value to be 1.0 (completely opaque).
00073             /// @param red Real representing the amount of red present in the colour.
00074             /// @param green Real representing the amount of green present in the colour.
00075             /// @param blue Real representing the amount of blue present in the colour.
00076             ColourValue(Real red, Real green, Real blue);
00077             /// @brief Alpha constructor.
00078             /// @details This constructor allows you to set the alpha value.
00079             /// @param red Real representing the amount of red present in the colour.
00080             /// @param green Real representing the amount of green present in the colour.
00081             /// @param blue Real representing the amount of blue present in the colour.
00082             /// @param alpha Real representing the transparency of the colours.
00083             ColourValue(Real red, Real green, Real blue, Real alpha);
00084             /// @brief Ogre constructor.
00085             /// @details Internal use only.  Constructs a colourvalue class from an ogre colourvalue.
00086             /// @param OgreValues The Ogre ColourValue class to base this class on.
00087             ColourValue(Ogre::ColourValue OgreValues);
00088             /// @brief Class destructor.
00089             ~ColourValue();
00090             /// @brief Creates and returns an Ogre ColourValue class with values equal to this one.
00091             /// @details This function is intended for internal use only.
00092             /// @return Returns an Ogre ColourValue class that has values equal to this one.
00093             Ogre::ColourValue GetOgreColourValue() const;
00094 
00095             /// @brief Equality Comparison Operator
00096             /// @param Colour This is another ColourValue to compare with.
00097             bool operator== (const ColourValue &Colour);
00098             /// @brief Inequality Comparison Operator
00099             /// @param Colour This is another ColourValue to compare with.
00100             bool operator!= (const ColourValue &Colour);
00101 
00102             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing no colour.
00103             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00104             static ColourValue GetBlank();
00105             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing the colour White.
00106             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00107             static ColourValue GetWhite();
00108             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing the colour Black.
00109             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00110             static ColourValue GetBlack();
00111             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing the colour Red.
00112             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00113             static ColourValue GetRed();
00114             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing the colour Green.
00115             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00116             static ColourValue GetGreen();
00117             /// @brief Creates a ColourValue representing the colour Blue.
00118             /// @return Returns the created ColourValue.
00119             static ColourValue GetBlue();
00120     };//colorvalue
00121 }//phys
00122 
00123 #endif
